---
title: throwIfAborted
---

The `throwIfAborted` function throws the reason for an aborted signal if the signal passed to it has been aborted. It is provided for environments where `new AbortSignal().throwIfAborted()` is not implemented.

## Import

```ts
import { throwIfAborted } from "@tai-kun/surrealdb/utils";
```

## Usage

```ts
function throwIfAborted(signal: AbortSignal | null | undefined): void;
```

#### Parameters

`signal`
:   The abort signal.

#### Returns

Void.
